definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The amount of power people use goes up and down, but it stays above a certain level all the time.
sentences.chinese: 人们的耗电量忽上忽下，但总会在一定水平之上。

sentences.english: My emotions went up and down the scale like a yo-yo.
sentences.chinese: 当时我的情绪就好象悠悠轮一样忽上忽下。

sentences.english: The aircraft was bumping up and down and jerking left to right.
sentences.chinese: 我们的机舱忽上忽下，左右摇晃。

sentences.english: The air was thick with butterflies, lifting, fluttering, settling.
sentences.chinese: 空中满是翩翩飞舞，忽上忽下的各种彩蝶。

sentences.english: Her thin shoulders lifted and fell as she rested her hands in her lap.
sentences.chinese: 她瘦弱的肩膀忽上忽下，双手放在大腿上。

sentences.english: I when read this book, the mood generally moves up and down unpredictably likely on the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 我在读这本书时，情绪就像股市一般忽上忽下。

sentences.english: The pillow moves with the waves. It bobs up and down.
sentences.chinese: 枕头随着波浪移动，它忽上忽下地来回摆动。

definition: to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
indifferent to the passing of time/careless
trough of a wave/(fig.) low point/lowest level
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
to move up and down/to undulate/ups and downs
